{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=WGR614 |revision=v2 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=07/01/2003 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PY3WGR614V2 |ic_id=4054A-WGR614V2 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=0.8 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR2312A |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=2 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=8 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR2312A |wi1_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip2_model=AR2112 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6060 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=NETGEAR |default_ssid_regex=^NETGEAR$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''54 Mbps Wireless Router''
{{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=WGR614v2|vs_id=2584}} {{TechInfoDepot|Netgear_WGT624_v1.0}} :The same hardware appears to be used (according to TechInfoDepot and [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=28654 the DD-WRT forum post linked from there]) for the WGT624v1 (minus Flash and RAM changes). [http://www.seattlewireless.net/NetgearWGR614#v2 On the SeattleWireless wiki] [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=189746 On the DD-WRT forums] (CPU part mentioned) According to the manual, the default SSID is '''NETGEAR'''. - Firmware and OS same with [[Netgear_WGR614v3]]
